def.dt: :a large vehicle that is used for carrying passengers especially along a particular route at particular times count She boarded a bus in Nashville. noncount I usually go to work by bus. = I usually take the bus to work. Are you traveling by train or by bus? often used before another noun a bus driver a bus station waiting at the bus stop [=one of the places where a bus stops for passengers to get on or off] see also school bus
:to transport (someone) in a bus often used as (be) bused Students from the other college were bused in for the game. The children are bused to school.
:to remove dirty dishes from (a table at a restaurant) He buses tables at the local diner.
:to remove (something, such as dirty dishes) We're supposed to bus [=clear] our own trays.
:a bus for carrying children to and from a school
